docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 -- Reassigning of Justice Department wartime functions, been last September, has been completed and the transfers of authority and personnel were made known today by Attorney General Biddle, who said they were made necessary by...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 -- Reassigning of Justice Department wartime functions, been last September, has been completed and the transfers of authority and personnel were made known today by Attorney General Biddle, who said they were made necessary by "the tremendous increase in the department's war duties and responsibilities."
docs.abstract: Reassigning of wartime functions completed; revd; personnel changes

headline.main: SHIFTS TO AID WAR MADE BY BIDDLE; He Announces Realignment of Personnel and Functions in Justice Department T.C. CLARK IN CRIME UNIT Heads Expanded Division, While Berge Becomes Chief of the Anti-Trust Program

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The exchange liner Gripsholm, painted white and carrying in huge letters on her side the word "Diplomat," sailed from her anchorage in New York Harbor early yesterday on her second mission to exchange Japanese civilians for Americans who have been...
docs.lead_paragraph: The exchange liner Gripsholm, painted white and carrying in huge letters on her side the word "Diplomat," sailed from her anchorage in New York Harbor early yesterday on her second mission to exchange Japanese civilians for Americans who have been interned in the Orient since December, 1941.
docs.abstract: Leaves US with Jap natls and relief supplies; ports of call listed

headline.main: 1,330 JAPANESE SAIL ON EXCHANGE LINER; Gripsholm Leaves on Second Trip -- Teia Maru to Bring Americans Back Home 1,330 Japanese Set Out From Here To Meet Ship Returning Americans

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 -- A request by the Argentine Government for a friendly gesture from President Roosevelt in the form of American armaments for Argentina and machinery for her oil industry was sternly rejected in a letter, made public tonight,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 -- A request by the Argentine Government for a friendly gesture from President Roosevelt in the form of American armaments for Argentina and machinery for her oil industry was sternly rejected in a letter, made public tonight, that Secretary of State Cordell Hull wrote on Aug. 30 to the Argentine Foreign Minister, Vice Admiral Segundo Storni.
docs.abstract: Sec Hull rejects Argentine plea for US aid

headline.main: Argentine Plea for U.S. Aid Is Sternly Rejected by Hull; ARGENTINE PLEA REJECTED BY HULL

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 10 -- The resignation of Foreign Minister Segundo Storni yesterday was followed today by a sudden shake-up in the higher posts of the Foreign Ministry. Roberto Gaches, Under-Secretary for Foreign Affairs, and Ricardo Bunge,...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 10 -- The resignation of Foreign Minister Segundo Storni yesterday was followed today by a sudden shake-up in the higher posts of the Foreign Ministry. Roberto Gaches, Under-Secretary for Foreign Affairs, and Ricardo Bunge, Director General of the Ministry and chief of the American Affairs section, were relieved of their posts.

headline.main: ARGENTINA OUSTS. TWO STORNI AIDES; Shake-Up in Foreign Ministry Replaces Under-Secretary, American Section Chief TEMPORARY HEAD NAMED Gilbert to Act Provisionally as Minister Until President Makes Appointment

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESBy Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
By Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: ON or about Sept. 24 a 5-centavos stamp (quantity, 20,000,000) will be issued to commemorate the "Restauracion de la Casa Historica de Tucuman" (Restoration of the Historic Tucuman House), the building which is equivalent to Independence Hall in...
docs.lead_paragraph: ON or about Sept. 24 a 5-centavos stamp (quantity, 20,000,000) will be issued to commemorate the "Restauracion de la Casa Historica de Tucuman" (Restoration of the Historic Tucuman House), the building which is equivalent to Independence Hall in Philadelphia.
docs.abstract: stamps supplementing '40 air-mail series in Bolivar-statue design described; illus

docs.snippet: A CENTURY ago, when Joaquin Suarez was President of Uruguay, Andres Lamas, Uruguayan historian, statesman and writer and founder of the Montevidean newspaper El Nacional, conceived the idea of establishing what would be known as the Historic and...
docs.lead_paragraph: A CENTURY ago, when Joaquin Suarez was President of Uruguay, Andres Lamas, Uruguayan historian, statesman and writer and founder of the Montevidean newspaper El Nacional, conceived the idea of establishing what would be known as the Historic and Geographic Institute of Uruguay.
docs.abstract: stamp issues commemorating Historic and Geographic Inst described; illus

headline.main: CENTENNIAL STAMPS FROM URUGUAY; Issue Is Dedicated to Institute Founded 100 Years Ago
